case.title: 1MDB Audit Report Tampering
case.subtitle: Obstruction of Justice Case Against Najib and Arul Kanda
case.description: This case involved allegations that former Prime Minister Najib Razak and former 1MDB CEO Arul Kanda Kandasamy conspired to tamper with the 2016 Auditor-General's Report on 1MDB before it was tabled in Parliament. The tampering allegedly aimed to protect Najib from scrutiny by removing or altering sections critical of 1MDB's management and financial dealings. Najib was charged under Section 28(1) of the MACC Act for abusing his position, while Arul Kanda was charged for abetting him.
case.verdictSummary: Both Najib Razak and Arul Kanda Kandasamy were found guilty. Najib was convicted of abuse of power and sentenced to 12 years imprisonment and fined RM210 million (to run concurrently with SRC sentence). Arul Kanda was convicted of abetting and sentenced to 12 years imprisonment and fined RM210 million, which was later varied.
case.metaDescription: Complete coverage of the 1MDB audit tampering trial - Najib Razak and Arul Kanda convicted for altering the Auditor-General's Report. Timeline and verdict details.

timeline.title: Najib and Arul Kanda Charged
timeline.description: Najib Razak was charged with abuse of power under Section 28(1) of the MACC Act 2009 for using his position to order amendments to the 1MDB audit report. Arul Kanda was charged with abetting Najib in the commission of the offence.

timeline.title: Trial Commences
timeline.description: The joint trial of Najib and Arul Kanda began before Justice Collin Lawrence Sequerah at the Kuala Lumpur High Court.

timeline.title: Former Auditor-General Testifies
timeline.description: Former Auditor-General Ambrin Buang testified that he was asked to make amendments to the final audit report on 1MDB.

timeline.title: Former Chief Secretary Testifies
timeline.description: Former Chief Secretary Ali Hamsa testified about meetings where the audit report was discussed and amendments were proposed.

timeline.title: Prosecution Closes Case
timeline.description: The prosecution closed its case after calling 18 witnesses including former government officials involved in the audit process.

timeline.title: Prima Facie Case Established
timeline.description: Justice Sequerah ruled that the prosecution established a prima facie case against both accused. They were called to enter their defence.

timeline.title: Najib Takes the Stand
timeline.description: Najib testified that he acted on advice and that the amendments were not intended to hide wrongdoing.

timeline.title: Arul Kanda Testifies
timeline.description: Arul Kanda testified that he followed instructions from the board and government in facilitating the amendments.

timeline.title: Both Found Guilty
timeline.description: Justice Sequerah found both Najib and Arul Kanda guilty. Najib was sentenced to 12 years imprisonment and fined RM210 million. Arul Kanda received the same sentence. Najib's sentence to run concurrently with his SRC International sentence.
